section.title: PIN extraction methods
section.indexterm: PIN block formatPIN extraction method keywords
section.p: Before a verb can process a formatted and encrypted PIN, the verb must decrypt the PIN block and extract the PIN from the PIN block. The PIN verbs can use multiple PIN-extraction methods. The valid PIN-extraction method depends on the PIN-block format. You can specify a PIN-extraction method or use the default method for the PIN-block format. To specify a PIN-extraction method, use a keyword in the rule_array variable for the verb. shows the keywords for the PIN-extraction methods that are valid for each PIN-block format. When only one PIN-extraction method is valid, the keyword is the default value. When more than one method is valid, the first keyword is the default value.
You can specify a PIN extraction keyword for a given PIN-block format in the , , and verbs.

section.p:
The PIN extraction methods operate as follows:
PINBLOCK Specifies that the service verb use one of these:
The PIN length, if the PIN block contains a PIN length field
The PIN delimiter character, if the PIN block contains a PIN delimiter character.
PADDIGIT Specifies that the verb use the pad value in the PIN profile to identify the end of the PIN.
HEXDIGIT Specifies that the verb use the first occurrence of a digit in the range from X'A' to X'F' as the pad value to determine the PIN length
PINLENnn Specifies that the verb use the length specified in the keyword, where nn can range from 04 - 16, the number of digits used to identify the PIN.
PADEXIST Specifies that the verb use the character in the 16th position of the PIN block as the value of the pad value.

section.title: Enhanced PIN security mode
section.p: An enhanced PIN security mode is available. This optional mode is selected by enabling the Enhanced PIN Security (offset X'0313') access control point in the default role.
When active, this control point affects all PIN verbs that extract or format a PIN using a PIN-block format of IBM 3624 with a PIN-extraction method of PADDIGIT .

row.entry: PIN processing changes when Enhanced PIN Security Mode enabled
The PINLENnn keyword in the rule_array parameter for PIN extraction method is not allowed if the Enhanced PIN Security Mode is enabled. The verb will fail with return code 8 and reason code X'7E0'.
IBM 3624 format and HEXDIGIT, PADDIGIT, or PADEXIST

PIN extraction determines the PIN length by scanning from right to left until a digit, not equal to the PAD digit, is found. The minimum PIN length is set at four digits, so scanning ceases one digit past the position of the fourth PIN digit in the block.
IBM 3624 format and HEXDIGIT, PADDIGIT, or PADEXIST
PIN formatting does not examine the PIN in the output PIN block to see if it contains the PAD digit.

section.title: Primary account number
section.p: A primary account number (PAN) identifies an individual and associates that individual to an account at the financial institution. The PAN consists of the following data:

For the ISO-0, ISO-3, and ISO-4 PIN-block formats, the PIN verbs use a PAN to format and extract a PIN. You specify the PAN with a parameter for the verb. Each digit in the PAN must be from 0 â€“ 9. You must specify the PAN in character format.

For ISO-0 and ISO-3, specify the PAN in a 12-byte field. The actual PAN might be more than 12 digits, but the PIN verbs use only 12 digits for the PAN. Depending on the PIN-block format, the verbs use the rightmost 12 digits or the leftmost 12 digits.

For the ISO-4 format, the verbs use all the digits of the PAN including the check digit. Note: When using the ISO-0 or ISO-3 PIN-block format, use the rightmost 12 digits of the PAN, excluding the check digit. When using the ISO-4 PIN-block format, use all digits of the PAN, including the check digit.
